Workflow Pattern Coverage in SAP
NetWeaver BPM 7.11

front.note:
Applies to:
SAP NetWeaver BPM 7.11
For more information, visit the Business Process Modeling homepage.
front.div:
Summary
When orchestrating activities and tasks, business processes typically follow specific workflow patterns. It's
fair to say that what workflow patterns have done for BPM is very much comparable to the impact of design
patterns in traditional software engineering. BPM "masterminds" Wil van der Aalst, Arthur ter Hofstede,
Alistair Barros, and others have exhaustively analyzed and classified various patterns linked to the control
flow, data flow, exception handling, and resource perspectives of business processes. As a result, BPM
practitioners may refer to their site www.workflowpatterns.com to look for patterns to be used in own process
modeling projects.
This article provides a reference for workflow patterns, supported in NetWeaver BPM (code-named
"Galaxy"), as of release 7.11. We do not only walk you through the most important patterns and show their
analogies in Galaxy's Process Composer design time but also provide examples for modeling scenarios that
incorporate more advanced patterns using BPMN.
